summary: The "Lower Costs for Everyday Americans Act" (HR 1768) is a wide-ranging bill addressing various issues. It includes provisions on recycling, consumer product safety (batteries), foreign adversary communications transparency, supply chain resilience, blockchain technology, rural broadband, music tourism, smart device disclosures, semiconductor supply chains, hotel fee transparency, ticketing transparency, and NTIA reauthorization. It also contains substantial sections on Medicaid, Medicare (including telehealth), and public health programs (opioids, pandemic preparedness, vaccine injury compensation).
